lexUnit.name: gather.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: retrieve and bring together crops

sentence.text: Throughout the main growing season vegetables , fruit and flowers are gathered or cut according to need , often before they are fully ripe .
Scathach used the periods of summer to hunt for food , and gather edible plants .
Insects can be gathered not only from their nests and tunnels , but from the air .
Seed must be gathered from freshly ripened seed pods .
Everything is growing apace , especially the weeds ; there are plants to be watered and crops to be gathered .
In the past , carnivorous plants have been gathered by unscrupulous collectors from the wild ; a practice that has depleted natural stocks .
We have to travel thousands of miles to gather the fruits , and vegetables of our labour .
I rose with the sun to gather mushrooms .
They were going to spend the day in the forest , gathering mushrooms and wild strawberries .
The men hunted and the women gathered plant food , and the produce was shared by members of the band .
Before that date it is known that the original Indian population of the Georgia coast hunted , fished and gathered their food .
Each year for six years he gathered the seed and planted each grain again .
Those which do not contain pyrozines naturally , gather them from noxious plants , either eating them as caterpillars or drinking them as adults .
Many of these hide in the day to avoid desiccation , and gather their food during the damper night .
